text.text_translated:
Scientists want to know how genes affect our brain and language. A gene is a part of the DNA in our bodies. Did a change in a gene give us the ability to speak? Scientists found a gene that changed a long time ago. This happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This gene seems important for speaking. It helps our brain control our mouth and face.

Monkeys have a similar gene. But their gene did not change. It is too early to know for sure how much genes affect language. But maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA.
